channel.title: Help with my vps
channel.description: Ok so I have my vps set up with my source running on it , but when I get people to sign in they can't connect , the IP in the client is the same ip as the vps , and windows firewall is disabled so I don't know what the problem is , what do I need to Do? Can anyone help me and if you want just skype me @ Daannnp

item.title: Help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @Kosmos Kosmos
item.description:
@Kosmos wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:551742”]If the firewall is disabled it won’t matter. But if it was enabled, yes, the firewall not allowing outbound connections would probably be the issue.
You can always get into contact with the VPS host to ask them if the port is being blocked by something on their end. I’m not your provider, so I can only do so much.[/quote]

The VPS im using is a basic one for now which doesnt offer technical support but the port isnt being blocked by them, any other ideas mate, add me on skype - daannnp

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If the firewall is disabled it won’t matter. But if it was enabled, yes, the firewall not allowing outbound connections would probably be the issue.
You can always get into contact with the VPS host to ask them if the port is being blocked by something on their end. I’m not your provider, so I can only do so much.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @Kosmos Kosmos
item.description:
@Kosmos wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:551742”][quote author=Kosmos link=topic=670658.msg4484426#msg4484426 date=1433005575]

First question:
When you run the server, does http://canyouseeme.org see it on port 43594?

No it doesn’t see it but when I use to run my server before with no-ip and not a vps canyouseeme never use to see 43594 either ??
[/quote]
canyouseeme will say success when your server is online and broadcasting on port 43594, assuming you told it to look on port 43594.
That service only checks if there is something broadcasting… So if you did not have the server on and you checked the port, it will always say it failed.
Make sure the firewall on the VPS is allowing connections to go through, both inbound and outbound.[/quote]

Firewall is disabled on the vps so it shouldn’t matter should it ? And I’ve got it allowed inbound but not outbound is that the problem ? And port 43594 says its not open on canyouseeme , I don’t know the problem ?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my vps
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kosmos, post:5, topic:551742”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670658.msg4484423#msg4484423 date=1433005263]
First question:
When you run the server, does http://canyouseeme.org see it on port 43594?
[/quote]

No it doesn’t see it but when I use to run my server before with no-ip and not a vps canyouseeme never use to see 43594 either ??[/quote]
canyouseeme will say success when your server is online and broadcasting on port 43594, assuming you told it to look on port 43594.
That service only checks if there is something broadcasting… So if you did not have the server on and you checked the port, it will always say it failed.
Make sure the firewall on the VPS is allowing connections to go through, both inbound and outbound.

Read full topic
